title: Data Transfer Hub
reLoignTips: This session has expired. To log in to Data Transfer Hub again, please click Login Again.

signin.signInToDRH: Sign in to Data Transfer Hub

title.getStartedDesc: Transfer data across partitions, or move from other cloud providers.

s3plugin.name: Amazon S3 Transfer Engine
s3plugin.desc: Transfer objects from different sources into Amazon S3.
s3plugin.feat1: Transfer Amazon S3 objects between Amazon Web Services regions
s3plugin.feat2: Transfer objects from Aliyun OSS / Tencent COS / Qiniu Kodo
s3plugin.feat7: Support transfer from S3 compatible storage

ecrPlugin.name: Amazon ECR Transfer Engine
ecrPlugin.desc: Transfer container images from different container registries into Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR).
ecrPlugin.feat1: Transfer Amazon ECR images between Amazon Web Services regions.
ecrPlugin.feat2: Transfer from Docker Hub, GCR.io, Quay.io etc.

tips.requiredCredential: Please select a Secret Key in Secrets Manager
tips.store3: Leave it blank for public bucket.

step2.selectSourceType: Select the source type among various providers.

source.title: Source settings
source.srcEndpointDesc: Source Endpoint URL, leave blank unless you want to use a custom Endpoint URL.
source.srcInAccountDesc: Select Yes, if the bucket is in the same Amazon Web Services account as Data Transfer Hub.
source.srcRegionNameDesc: You can enter region name or region code.
source.prefixDesc: It will only transfer objects with the provided prefix.
source.includeMetadataDesc3: This will have additional API cost.
source.objectACLDesc3: Use the default value if you don't want to set the object ACL.
source.nameOfPrefixListDesc: Upload the prefix list (.txt file, one prefix per line) in root directory of source bucket. E.g. prefix_list.txt
source.govCloudTips: GovCloud data transfer limited in US
source.payerRequestDesc: S3 Payer Request required the Requestor pay DTO fee

dest.title: Destination settings
dest.destInAccountDesc: Select Yes, if the bucket is in the same Amazon Web Services account as Data Transfer Hub.
dest.prefixDesc: The data transfer engine will insert this prefix for all objects. It will automatically append '/'.
dest.storageClassDesc: Objects will be stored with the selected storage class.
dest.destRegionNameDesc: You can enter region name or region code.

credential.title: Credentials
credential.whitch: Which bucket in current Amazon Web Services account?
credential.whitchDesc: Select Source if your source bucket is in the same account as Data Transfer Hub. Otherwise, select Destination.
credential.store: Secret key name in Secrets Manager
credential.storeDesc: Choose the Secret key in Secrets Manager.

advance.title: Engine settings
advance.LambdaMemoryDesc: Set the default Lambda memory, default is 256 MB.
advance.multipartThresholdDesc: Threshold size for multipart upload in MB, default is 10 MB.
advance.chunkSizeDesc: Chunk size for multipart upload in MB, default is 5 MB.
advance.maxThreadsDesc: Max threads to run multipart upload in Lambda, default is 10.
advance.finderDepthDesc: The depth of sub folders to compare in parallel. 0 means comparing all objects in sequence.
advance.finderNumberDesc: The number of find threads to run in parallel.
advance.workerThreadsNumberDesc: The number of worker threads to run in one instance. By default is 4, for those small objects. When the object size more than 1TB, recommend set up to 1.
advance.schedulingSettingsDesc1: Set task scheduling by selecting fixed rate manually or using CRON expression. Please select 'One time transfer' if it is an one-time task. See
advance.skipComparisonDesc: If select yes, a finder will execute data comparison before transferring to avoid duplicated transfer. If select no, a worker will start transfer directly.
advance.oneTimeTips: When the task 'Completed', the transfer action will stop and you can select 'Stop' to delete and release all backed resource.
advance.fixedRateError: Task Scheduling must larger or equal than 2 minutes.

more.title: More
more.descriptionDesc: Input the description of the task.
more.emailDesc: Notification will be sent to this email if any errors.

valid.accountRequired: Please input Amazon Web Services account ID

source.title: Source settings
source.sourceRegionDesc: You can enter region name or region code.
source.sourceInAccountDesc: Select YES, if the Amazon ECR is in current account.
source.accountIdTips: Enter the Amazon Web Services Account ID (12 digits).
source.tips: Please select a Secret Key in Secrets Manager
source.dockerImagesDesc: Select the container images to transfer.
source.image1: Enter all images in format of
source.image4: delimited by comma. If tag is omitted, the latest tag will be used.
source.image5: If tag is ALL_TAGS, all the tags of this image will be used.

dest.title: Destination settings
dest.destinationRegionDesc: You can enter region name or region code.
dest.destInAccountDesc: Select YES, if the Amazon ECR is in current account.
dest.prefixDesc: Add the prefix to all images. Default is none.

step3.step1TypeDesc: Serverless Edition. Serverless edition is ideal for real-time transfer, and you pay as you go.
step3.credentialDesc: Please create a Secret Key in Secrets Manager, you can use default name drh-credentials (optional), select SecureString as its type, and put a Value following below format.

taskList.title: Tasks

tips.selectTaskStop: Please select a task to stop
tips.confimStop: Are you sure you want to stop the Task

taskList.viewInFinder: View more logs in Finder Logs
taskList.viewWorker1: Please check the warning email in the mailbox or
taskList.viewWorker2: View more logs in Worker Logs
taskList.viewWorker3: , or re-create the transfer task to complete the difference

taskDetail.stopTaskTips: Are you sure you want to stop this Task?

bottom.copy: Amazon Web Services, Inc. or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

error.destPrefixInvalid: Do not append / at the end of the prefix

credential.name: Credentials
credential.formatDesc: Copy the following credential, and replace with your own value in the plaintext tab.

engineSettings.name: Engine settings
engineSettings.tip1: This is the advanced settings to tune the performance of the application.
engineSettings.tip2: Recommend to adjust this settings only under the guidance of Amazon Web Services Solutions Architect.

engineEdition.name: Engine Edition
engineEdition.tip1: Choose the right data transfer engine for the task.
engineEdition.tip2: Use the Graviton2 instances to read and write to the buckets.
engineEdition.tip3: is enabled in this edition which can provide better network performance. Especially recommend for data transfer between Amazon Web Services regions.
engineEdition.tip4: Amazon Lambda has its advantage in concurrency. Every Amazon Web Services Account can have 1000 maximum concurrency by default.
engineEdition.learnMoreTitle: How to enable TCP BBR to improve network speed on Linux?

s3BucketSrcPrefix.name: Object Prefix
s3BucketSrcPrefix.desc: The S3 transfer engine will transfer the objects with the certain prefix only. For example, prefix photos will match objects like photos/a.jpg, photos.jpg or photosa.jpg.

s3BucketDestPrefix.name: Prefix to Insert
s3BucketDestPrefix.tips1: The S3 transfer engine will insert the prefix before all objects. Leave it empty if you don’t want to insert prefix.
s3BucketDestPrefix.tips2: For example, if the prefix is
s3BucketDestPrefix.tips2_1: and the object key in source bucket is
s3BucketDestPrefix.tips3: . Then the object key in destination bucket is
s3BucketDestPrefix.tips5: at the end of the prefix. The engine will append it automatically.

engineSettingsEC2.name: Engine settings
engineSettingsEC2.tip1: The S3 transfer engine use Amazon EC2 Graviton2 in an Auto Scaling Group to transfer objects. You can adjust the concurrency by setting the minimum,  maximum and desired instance number. The transfer engine will auto scale between the minimun value and maximum value.
engineSettingsEC2.tip2: You can adjust these numbers on Amazon Web Services Console after creating the task.
engineSettingsEC2.linkName: Adjust the Auto Scaling Group to change the transfer concurrency.

comparisonInfo.name: Data Comparison
comparisonInfo.tip2: 1) Less data duplication between source and destination.
comparisonInfo.tip3: 2) Willing to reduce the time for data comparison.

finderDepthNumber.tip1: If there're 10 subdirectories with over 100k files each, it's recommended to set finderDepth=1 and finderNumber=10
finderDepthNumber.tip2: If the transferred files are under two tier subdirectories, with 10 tier 1 subdirectories and 15 tier 2 subdirectories incl. over 100k leaf objects each. It is recommended to set finderDepth=2, finderNumber=10*15=150

finderMemory.name: Finder Memory
finderMemory.tip1: Memory setting is relevant to the number of objects to be transferred, see details as below:
finderMemory.notSupport: Doesn't support for now. Recommend dividing into multiple tasks. Or using Finder Depth and Finder Number to tuning the task.

logGroup.name: Log Group Name
logGroup.filterStrem: Filter log streams or try prefix search

logEvent.name: Log events:
logEvent.hasOlder: There are older events to load.
logEvent.noOlder: No older events at this moment.
logEvent.hasNewer: There are newer events to load.
logEvent.noNewer: No newer events at this moment.
